page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT
page.content: A DAIRYMAN STARTS HIS DAY VERY EARLY IN THE MORNING TO ENABLE HIM TO MILK THE COWS TWICE WITHIN THE DAY.THE DAY STARTS AT 3.30A.M. WHEN THE COWS ARE MILKED AND THE CALVES FED.AT 6.30 HE HAS HIS BREAKFAST AND AT 7.30 IT IS TIME TO FEED THE COWS.THE PASSAGES IN THE SHED ARE CHECKED AND CLEANED AND THE CALVING COWS ARE CHECKED TO SEE THEY ARE IN GOOD HEALTH. COME 10.00A.M IT IS REST TIME AND DINNER BREAK UNTIL 1.30P.M. THE YOUNG CALVES ARE FED AGAIN AND THE COWS ARE COLLECTED FOR MILKING.COFFEE BREAK COMES AT 2.30P.M FOR 15 MINUTES, BEFORE THE COWS ARE ACTUALLY MILKED. AROUND 4.45 THE MILKING PARLOUR IS CLEANED OUT AND ONCE MORE THE CALVING COWS ARE CHECKED TO SEE ALL ARE WELL.THEN AT LAST AT 5.15P.M. THE DAYS WORK IS OVER. MILKING IS BY MACHINE.
